page.title: 05The Fordingbridge Infirmary.
page.content: In the early days, the Parish was responsible for the care of the poor. In the 17th century a{Workhouse}was established in Shaftesbury Street. After a fire in 1830, new buildings were erected in 1835. These were replaced in 1885, when a large and roomy{Union Workhouse}was built in The Bartons. On the nationalization of the hospital service in 1948,it became{The {Infirmary.}This year an extension has been added. This replaces{The Cottage {Hospital.}Many elderly people are cared for by nursing staff and the local doctors. Some of the patients will live the rest of their lives there. Many of them join the day patients for their meals in the day room. Ladies from local organisations come in on a voluntary basis. They play simple games with the patients and help to entertain them.
